Gowri,

My current approach to testing any of our J2EE work is to not test =
any
Entity, Session or Message-Driven Beans.  I have faith in Entity Beans,=

hence I do not test them at all.  For Session and Message-Driven Beans, I
=
code these to rely on a number of collaborating classes.  In other words,
t=
hese beans contain code that simply directs the interaction of other
classe=
s.  Since these other classes are not beans, test fixture for them is
easy =
to set up and tear down, and I test them.  For example, I might have a
Mess=
age-Driven Bean that gives its received message to a class that parses
the =
message.  The result of parsing might then be handed to another class
(or c=
lasses) that does (that do) some work.  Finally, the result of such
work wo=
uld be passed to a communicator class that knows where the results
need to =
go and how to send them there.

In brief, I've found that the design of our=
 J2EE work is greatly improved
with this approach.  For any of our existing=
 code that isn't written this
way, I try to push it in that direction with =
each refactoring session.

I hope that this approach offers some insight or=
 a point of view not yet
considered.

Best wishes,
Craig
